shortdesc.ph: Reports the statistics of the video stream sent by each remote users.
Callback for remote video stream transport statistics during a call.
Callback for transport statistics of the remote video stream during a call.
Callback for transport statistics of remote video streams during a call.

p.codeblock: onRemoteVideoTransportStats?( connection: RtcConnection, remoteUid: number, delay: number, lost: number, rxKBitRate: number ): void;
onRemoteVideoTransportStats?( connection: RtcConnection, remoteUid: number, delay: number, lost: number, rxKBitRate: number ): void;
final void Function(RtcConnection connection, int remoteUid, int delay, int lost, int rxKBitRate)? onRemoteVideoTransportStats;
public virtual void OnRemoteVideoTransportStats(RtcConnection connection, uint remoteUid, UInt16 delay, UInt16 lost, UInt16 rxKBitRate) {}

dlentry.dd: Deprecated: This callback is deprecated. Use instead.
Deprecated: This callback has been deprecated. Use instead.
Deprecated: This callback is deprecated. Use instead.
Deprecated: This callback is deprecated. Use instead.

section.p: This callback reports end-to-end network statistics of a remote user during a call, calculated based on video packets. It provides objective data such as packet loss and network latency to reflect the current network status. During a call, when a user receives video data packets from a remote user/host, this callback is triggered every 2 seconds.

This callback describes end-to-end network statistics of remote users during a call based on video packets. It uses objective data such as packet loss and network delay to reflect the current network status. During a call, once the user receives video data packets from a remote user/host, this callback is triggered every 2 seconds.

This callback reports end-to-end network statistics of the remote user during a call, calculated based on video packets. It objectively shows the current network status through data such as packet loss and network delay. During a call, this callback is triggered every 2 seconds after the user receives video packets sent by the remote user/host.

This callback reports end-to-end network statistics of remote users during a call, calculated based on video packets. It provides objective data such as packet loss and network delay to reflect the current network status. During a call, when a user receives video packets sent by a remote user/host, this callback is triggered every 2 seconds.

plentry.pd: Connection information. See .
The user ID indicating which user/host the video packet belongs to.
The latency (ms) from the sender to the receiver of the video packet.
The packet loss rate (%) from the sender to the receiver of the video packet.
The received bitrate (Kbps) of the remote video packet.
Connection information. See .
User ID indicating which user/host the video packet belongs to.
Delay (ms) from sender to receiver for the video packet.
Packet loss rate (%) from sender to receiver for the video packet.
Receiving bitrate (Kbps) of the remote video packet.
Connection information. See .
User ID specifying which user/host the video packet belongs to.
Delay (ms) from the sender to the receiver for the video packet.
Packet loss rate (%) from the sender to the receiver for the video packet.
Received bitrate (Kbps) of the remote video packet.
Connection information. See .
User ID that specifies whose video packet it is (user/host).
Delay (ms) from sender to receiver for the video packet.
Packet loss rate (%) from sender to receiver for the video packet.
Receiving bitrate of the remote video packet (Kbps).
